attributes.action: Brtish people should have the right to choose where to live without penalty
attributes.additional_details:
Pensioners who made their full national insurance contributions throughout their working lives should not have their pensions frozen and denied statutory increase just because of their country of residence. Under current Government rules pensioners who retire abroad only get state pension increases in line with inflation if they live in countries with reciprocal arrangements. All Commonwealth countries would welcome and support the British government to pay its pensioner their indexed pension.
Many who are denied indexing of their British state pension worked and fought for the freedom that the British people have today. What goverment can possibly deny payment to those who paid their full national insurance contributions throughout their working lives?
